quote: Raimus isn't going to be happy    about this.
What are you going to do?
I don't know.         And don't you mean what are we   going to do?
Raimus told you to get the    merchandise.
I'll figure something out.
You'd better.
I said I'd figure it out.       I'm hungry.
Let's have Krellan food.
Last time it gave me heartburn.
That's because you eat too fast.
I eat when I'm hungry. And when   I'm hungry, I eat fast.
If you're not careful, that    appetite of yours will kill you    someday.
Don't get your hopes up.
We're using that.
Order some Nozala wraps.
I've accessed the system...
Tell them to deliver extra Vilm    sauce.
Who should I bill this to?
I don't care who pays, as long as    it isn't us.
How about...       -- the police?
No, we billed them for dinner last   night.
Municipal Sanitation? Do you have   their account code?
I will in a minute.
Krole.
Don't --       He's being spiked.
Are you all right?
That hurt.
They spiked him. Somebody spiked    him over a free lunch. What is    this city coming to?
Look at this. Fused.
Too bad. That's an expensive    piece of hardware.
What are we going to do?
Don't you mean what is Krole going    to do?
I can't go to Raimus and ask him    to pay for a replacement.
Mind if I have look?
It might not be as bad as it    seems...
Are you saying you can fix it?
That depends.
On what?
How much are you willing to pay?
Do you know who I am?
No.
If you did, you wouldn't be asking    that.
All right, then. Who are you?
Listen, Mister... ?
Connelly.

I've seen you around the last few    weeks. You're always in here    tinkering with one piece of junk    or another, which tells me that    things aren't exactly going too    well for you. So here's my advice --    (handing him the     dataport)    Take this and bring it back here    tomorrow morning fixed and    polished.
Tomorrow morning it is.
Come on. Let's get some lunch...
Bilby wants me to fix this for    him.
I'm impressed. I don't think    anyone's ever managed to make    contact with the Orion Syndicate    so quickly. How'd you do it?
I spiked one of Bilby's men while    he was interfacing.
That was a risky thing to do.
Maybe. But it got me noticed. I    want to get this mission over with    so I can go home.
I realize you didn't exactly    volunteer for this. Believe me,    I wish we hadn't been forced to    turn to someone outside Starfleet    Intelligence for help.
Me, too.
The Syndicate killed another one    of our undercover operatives last    week.
That makes five in the past year.
We need you to find out who their    informant in Starfleet is. Once    you give me the name, I'll put you    on the next transport home.
What do you want me to do now?

Bilby will check into your    background. Everything he finds    will confirm that you're a fix-it    man down on your luck. Stick to    that cover. The Syndicate is    always looking for people with    your skills. If Bilby offers you    more work, take it. Get as close    to him as possible.
Right.
If you need anything, you know how    to contact me.
O'Brien.
Don't take anymore unnecessary    risks. These are dangerous men.    If they find out who you are,    they'll kill you.
Major, sorry to --            Excuse me, Major
After you.                    Go ahead.
There's something wrong with --
All right.        You first, then you.
I need an engineering crew to run    a diagnostic on the internal    security sensors. We've been    having an unusual number of false    alarms lately.
I'll have someone take a look as    soon as possible.
There's something wrong with the    fire suppression system in the    bar. Every time I serve a flaming    cocktail, the system engages and    snuffs it out.
I'll put it on the list.
Please do. You wouldn't believe    what people are willing to pay for    a glass of burning alcohol.
Excuse me, major --
Let me guess. There's a    malfunction in the Infirmary.
How did you know?
Major, there is something wrong    with the turbolift.
I can see that.
We seem to be having a lot of    system glitches.
It happens every time Chief    O'Brien goes away.
I do not understand why his staff    can't keep the station running in    his absence.
He must've left my idiot brother    in charge.
The engineering crews are doing    the best they can.
The problem is no one knows how    the chief keeps all this    Federation and Cardassian    technology working together.
We've got to do something. This    can't go on.
Sorry, I can't discuss the chief's    whereabouts.
scene: 8B   INT. CAPTAIN'S OFFICE - CLOSE ON SISKO

quote: I understand that, sir. But this    is getting ridiculous. How much    longer are we going to have to put    up with these malfunctions?
scene: 8B   INT. CAPTAIN'S OFFICE - CLOSE ON SISKO

quote: You know, it wouldn't surprise me    if Major Kira or Commander Worf    came in here demanding answers.    But you? It's not your style.
scene: 8B   INT. CAPTAIN'S OFFICE - CLOSE ON SISKO

quote: Apparently it is. Here I am.
scene: 8B   INT. CAPTAIN'S OFFICE - CLOSE ON SISKO

quote: I'm not buying it, doctor. You    didn't come in here to complain,    you came in here because you're    worried about your friend and you    want me to put your mind at ease.
scene: 8B   INT. CAPTAIN'S OFFICE - CLOSE ON SISKO

quote: I wish I could.         If it helps, I will tell you this --   the chief can take care of himself    about as well as anyone I know.
scene: 8B   INT. CAPTAIN'S OFFICE - CLOSE ON SISKO

quote: You're right about that, sir.
scene: 8B   INT. CAPTAIN'S OFFICE - CLOSE ON SISKO

quote: Did you fix it?
Any feedback?
Feedback gives him a headache.
There's no feedback.
We'll see.
I told you.
Very impressive. If I was a    suspicious man, I might ask myself    how a tinkerer living in one room    on Jinami Street managed to fix    such a complicated piece of    hardware so quickly.
Good question.
How do you know where I live?
I know a lot about you. Maybe    more than you want me to.
Come with me.
Where are we going?
For a walk.
Have a seat.
Not there.
Chester doesn't like people    sitting in his chair.
Don't touch anything.
Something wrong?
You tell me.
Do you think I brought you here to    kill you?
Why would I kill somebody who can    fix things for me?         I guess a man who's been knocked    around as much as you have is    always expecting the worst.
I've pretty much had to get used    to the idea that I've got bad    luck.
That was a tough break you had on    Dayos Four -- two years for    dealing in stolen goods.
I didn't know the stuff was    stolen. I guess I should've asked    the guy I bought it from, huh?

Who's to say he would've told you    the truth?        Take this for example. My    employer asked me to get three    Klingon disruptors for him. Did    the man I bought them from tell me    they didn't work? No, he did not.        Have a look.
The induction coil is burned out.
Can you fix it?
Sure.
Glad to hear it. That's going to    make my employer very happy.
What does he want with Klingon    disruptors?
I didn't ask. When Raimus tells    you to do something, you just do    it.        Hungry?
A little.
Have some cake. My wife sent it.
No, thanks.
Go ahead.
It's good.
She made it herself.    (pointing out a FRAMED     PICTURE)    That's her. With my children.
Very nice. Where are they?
New Sydney. I'd love to have them    here on Farius, but considering    the business I'm in, it's not a    good idea.        Do you have a family?
No.
You should. It's the most    important thing.    (pointing to the     picture)    I send them everything. I pay my    fare to Raimus, the rest goes    straight to my wife.
Your "fare?"
To Raimus. Every month. That's    how it works. He's above me in    the organization.
You do know what organization I'm    referring to, don't you?
I think so.
Good.        Krole and Flith -- the gentlemen    you met earlier, they're below me.
Lucky them.
If you fix these disruptors for    me, you could be lucky, too.
That's good to know.
Don't misunderstand. I'm not    making any promises. I need to be    sure I can trust you first.
More cake?
No, thanks.
I thought you were hungry.
I'm all right.
What's the matter? You don't like    my wife's cake?
I didn't say that.
Answer me. Do you like my wife's    cake?
To tell you the truth, it's a    little dry.
You're right. It is.
I had you wondering which way to    jump, didn't I? Flith and Krole    always act like it's the best    thing they've ever tasted.
What do you make of that, Chester?    I found myself an honest man.    Must be my lucky day...
The induction coils you asked for.    Courtesy of the Klingon Ambassador    to Farius.
There's a Klingon Ambassador here?    Gowron must not like him too much.
Do you have any idea why Raimus    wants these disruptors?
Bilby doesn't even know.
Listen... is there any way I can    talk to my wife, let her know I'm    all right?
We can't risk it.
I'm sorry.
I'd better be going.
Flith, go stand over there.
Why?
I want to see if he really fixed    this.
Very funny.
Contact Raimus and tell him we    have the disruptors.
(to O'Brien; re: the     disruptors)    Good job.
I'm curious about something... how    did you get a hold of replacement    parts? Klingon technology isn't    easy to come by.
You just have to know who to go   to.
Why don't you enlighten us? In    case we need to procure something    else.
I have a better idea. Why don't    you stay out of my business?
Tell us where you got the parts --    we can always use a good contact.
I can't.
Why not?
My supplier would rather remain    anonymous.
I don't care what your supplier    wants. I'm asking you a question.
I told him I wouldn't say.
Where'd you get the parts?
I stole them.
You stole them?
From a warehouse down on Degora    Street.
Why didn't you just say so?
I thought it'd be better you    didn't know -- in case the police    catch up with me.
You lied to me so that I wouldn't    be implicated?
I'm sorry.
Did you hear that? He was willing    to protect me if he got caught.        As hard as I try, I can't imagine    either of you being willing to do    that.
You know something? I think it's   time we do something about the way   you look.
What do you think?
He looks fine.
What are you talking about? I   took him to the same tailor I use.
You look fine, too.
Nice handkerchief.
I understand you've been looking    for me.
That's right.
I take it you're in the market for    something.
If I was, I wouldn't buy it from    the man who sold me three useless    disruptors.
You know me better than that.
I thought I did.
Those disruptors were working fine    when I gave them to you. What    happened after that, I don't know.    Maybe you dropped them.
I want my money back.
You know I can't do that. You    took delivery.
Let me get something straight...    you're telling me there was    nothing wrong with this when you    sold it to me?
That's correct.
Maybe I just don't know how to    work it.
That must be it.
What do you know? I figured it    out.
Bilby --
Do you know what would've happened    if I'd given Raimus three useless    disruptors? He would've killed me.
If you want your money back, you    can have it...
Why would I want my money back?    It works fine now.
No one takes me for a fool.
I will do whatever it takes to    protect what I have.

This life... it's not for    everyone. Sometimes I wish I    could just get away from it all.        But then, what would I do with    myself? I'm too old to start    over. Besides, who am I to    complain? The organization has    given me opportunities that I    never thought I'd have. Once    you're part of it, once you're    accepted -- there are no limits to    what you can do if you're smart    about it.
Smart and careful.
I'm glad to see you're paying    attention.        We have people everywhere. Even    Earth. Hell, we even have a man    in Starfleet.
Come on. Starfleet?
That's correct.
Do me a favor. Remind me to pick    up something for my daughter    tomorrow. Her birthday's coming    up.
Sure thing.
I'd like to be there. I hope I    can get away.
How'd you manage to get to someone    in Starfleet?
It wasn't me, it was Raimus.        Do you want to come to New Sydney    with me -- meet my family?
If you go, sure.       How did he do it?
Why all the questions?
Nothing. It's just hard to    believe someone in Starfleet could    be bought. It makes me wonder if    he's a double-agent.
A double-agent? Then why would he    have given us the names of all    their undercover operatives?

Don't worry, he's the real thing.    Raimus met him when he was    vacationing on Risa last year.    Mister Starfleet was in charge of    the weather control system.        Raimus offered him a very    substantial amount of money to    make it stop raining.
I guess everyone has their price.
It's Krole. Raimus wants to see   me.
In the middle of the night?
Bilby.
Raimus.
I brought someone here to meet    you.
I hope I didn't get you gentlemen    out of bed.
Who's this? Bilby, who is this?
He's someone I know.
I've never seen him before. How    well do you know him?
I know him.
Then it's settled.
Is that the extent of your   security precautions?
Bilby witnessed for him.
That's all that's necessary.
If you say so.       So... this is Bilby.
He seems capable enough.
I told you.
(putting him in his     place)   I wanted to see for myself.
You procured the disruptors for   us.
That's right.
We're going to ask you to do    something else. Something very    important.
You can count on me.
I hope so.        We'll contact you when it's time.
Raimus.
Don't let me down.
I won't.
My love to your family.
Do you know what I just did for    you?
I think so.
I witnessed for you.
If anything happens, I'm    accountable.
I understand.
Good.
Nice suit.
Bilby got it for me..
That's very generous.
He's like that.
I found out who the informant is.
Bilby told me that he was in    charge of the weather control    system on Risa, about a year ago.
It should be easy enough to find    out who that was.
Yeah.
Something wrong?
Raimus brought someone to meet    with Bilby. A Vorta.
You're telling me that the Orion    Syndicate is working for the    Dominion?
Opens up a lot of possibilities,    doesn't it?
None of them very pleasant.
So... do I get to go home now?
Not until you find out what's    going on.
I was afraid you were going to say    that...
All right. I've accessed the    Bank's data files.
I'm reading a three-tier security    protocol.
I see it.
Looks like an isolation matrix is    protecting the data. You'll have    to bypass the encryption lockouts.
You make it sound so easy.
Watch out for recursive dataloops,    you don't want to get diverted    into a backflow.
I'm past the lockouts.
Sweep the matrix... give me an    access point...
Stand by.
Go.
Initiating data transfer --
Faster.
I'm trying --
I can't hold the matrix open much   longer.
Hurry.
Got it. Let's get out.       Faster, Krole -- they're tracing   you.
The lockouts are closing --
Move.
Come on --
I'm out.
We did it.
Gentlemen, we just robbed the Bank   of Bolias...
I was thinking about opening an   account there...
Better go with another bank.
(through gales of     laughter)   One with... better... security...
He's good.
He's all right.
Let's celebrate.
Who's buying?
You are.
I had you.       Did you see the look on his face?       Come on. What are you having?
You're late. I was starting to    worry.
Sorry.
It's all right. I imagine the    Dominion is keeping you busy.
Nothing's happened with that yet.    I was just doing something with    Bilby.
Anything worth reporting?
No. We went to the races.         We came out ahead.
I'm glad to hear you're enjoying    your assignment.
You told me to get close to him.    He wanted to go, so I went with    him.
There's no need to explain. I've    been under cover.
Bilby witnessed for me.
Sounds like you've really got your    hooks in him.
What's going to happen to him when    you pull me out?
That's nothing you need to think    about.
They're going to kill him, aren't    they?
Listen to me. Bilby chose this    life. Whatever happens to him is    his fault, not yours.
Besides, if he's lucky we'll get    to him before they do. He'll be    safe in a Federation prison.         Just help us make a good case    against him.
Right
What do you mean you don't want   to? I brought her here for you.
I appreciate it, but...
But what?       Don't tell me you don't like   girls?
(having to say     something)   I've got a girl already.
Since when?
A few days, a week. I don't know.
That's great. Why didn't you say   anything?
I don't know. It didn't come up.
I understand. But there's no    reason to hurt this girl's    feelings.
We've got to discuss business.    (slipping her some     money)    Why don't you go home, I'll call    you in a couple of days.
So who is she? This new girl?
Her name's... Kimiko.
Where'd you meet her?
She works in a flower shop.    Arranging flowers.
Bring her by sometime. I'd like    to meet her.
I will.
A man your age should settle down    and have a family -- it's the most    important thing.
I don't know if it's that serious    yet.

Let me talk to her for three    minutes and I'll let you know if    she's the marrying kind. I can    read people right away. What's in    their hearts. You for instance.    I saw through you the first time    I laid eyes on you.
Oh, yeah?
I don't think I'd ever seen    someone so alone in my entire    life.
I said to myself, that man doesn't    have a friend in the quadrant.         Flith and Krole thought you were    a snake.
Really?
But I knew better. And when you    came back the next day with that    dataport repaired, that's when I    knew -- we were going to do great    things together.

I'm about to take a step up in the    organization. Raimus is giving me    an opportunity and I'm going to    make the best of it. Everything's    changing, I can feel it.         And it all started when you came    along. You changed my luck.
And I thought you changed mine...
I'm going to take care of you. I    don't forget my friends. Because    friends are like family -- nothing    is more important. Nothing.
Morning, Graife.
Raimus... I didn't know you were   coming.
I can see that.
Can I get you something?       Graife, make us a strong pot of --
Bilby. This isn't a social visit.
So. Which one is it?
Wait. Don't tell me. Let me see   if I can guess.
They say you can tell a traitor by   looking in his eyes.
Do you think that's true?
I wouldn't know.       Raimus, what's this all about?
What does it look like?
If you ask me, none of them look   particularly trustworthy.
Raimus --
Not now.
But --
I said not now.
Him.
I've been saying so all along.
Raimus, this is crazy. He doesn't    know what he's talking about.
He was going to be my second    guess.
What did he do?
Whatever it was... it must've been    very stupid.
Let's just say he conducted some    business on the side and neglected    to pay his fare.        It's a good thing you never    witnessed for him or you'd be    lying there, too.
Well, now that that's out of the    way...        Shall we discuss the matter at    hand?
We mentioned we were going to ask    you to do something for us.
Anything you need.
So accommodating. He reminds me    of a Jem'Hadar.
We want you to assassinate the    Klingon Ambassador to Farius.
All right.
You'll use the disruptors you    procured earlier.
You want it to look like he was    killed by a rival House.
Connelly --
It's all right.
Very astute. Do you know much    about political affairs?
Not really.

Then let me enlighten you. The    ambassador has been advocating    that the Klingons break off their    alliance with the Federation and    concentrate on defending the    Empire against the Dominion.    Chancellor Gowron, on the other    hand, is adamantly committed to    the alliance.
You're going to make it look like    Gowron ordered the assassination.

Exactly. The ambassador will be    seen as a martyr. And his cause    will gain strength. If all goes    well, the Klingons will retreat    into their own territory, and all    we'll have to deal with is the    Federation.
Makes sense.
I'm glad you think so.        Needless to say, it's very    important that the Dominion's part    in this be kept secret.
If something goes wrong and you    get captured, you never met our    friend here.
I understand.
I knew I could count on you.
I never realized how much the    Dominion and the Orion Syndicate    have in common -- it seems that in    both organizations...    (as his eyes settle on     O'Brien)    -- loyalty is everything.
How are they planning to get past    the Embassy's security?
Bilby asked me the same thing. I    figured out a way to interrupt the    power grid for a few seconds -    Bilby and his men will be able to    beam in before the backup    generator kicks in.
When is this supposed to happen?
Tonight.
I'll contact the Klingons so they    can be ready for them.
What are you talking about? If    the Klingons get their hands on    Bilby and his men, they'll kill    them.
That's not really our business, is    it?
You're setting them up to be    murdered.
You have things backwards. Bilby    and his friends are the ones that    murder people. Not us.
No, we get the Klingons to do it    for us.

All I'm doing is following    procedures and warning our allies    about a possible assassination    attempt. What happens after that    is not my concern.        But believe me, if the Klingons    decide to go after Raimus and the    Orion Syndicate, I won't shed any    tears.
No. I don't suppose you will.
Miles, listen to me. You've lost    perspective. You're starting to    sympathize with these people.    It's a good thing we're pulling    you out.
Pulling me out?
We're putting you on the next    transport home. Your assignment's    over.
You told me we were going to make    a case against Bilby... you told    me he was going to prison...
I'm sorry, I didn't want to    mislead you, but you were starting    to waver. I needed to keep you on    track.
Come on. Let's get you home.
Chadwick.
Here you go, Chester.
Who could that be?
Come to see me off?
We need to talk.
It'll have to wait. I was just    leaving.
You can't go.
What are you talking about?
Look, just trust me. You can't    go.
Why not?
It's a trap.
Listen to me. The Klingons know    what you're planning to do.
That's impossible.
Someone traced my signal when I    accessed the power grid.
I watched you access the grid -   you cut off the trace.
No, they just let me think I had.
You're panicking.    (throwing an arm around     his shoulder)    Try not to worry so much.
You're the one who should be    worried. Do you have any idea    what the Klingons will do to you    when they catch you?
They're not going to catch me.
Yes, they are! Starfleet    Intelligence is going to warn them    you're coming.
How do you know that? I suppose    you work for them.
What if I said I did?
Very good. You had me. For a    minute there I actually thought    you were working for Starfleet.
I am.
Come on, enough. You had me. I    admit it.
I am working for Starfleet --
I said enough! I don't want to    hear it. Do you understand? I do    not want to hear it.
Why'd you have to come here...    why'd you have to tell me that?
I couldn't just let you go. The    Klingons will kill you.
I'm dead already! Can't you see    that? I witnessed for you. Do    you have any idea what that means?
What if I can get you off Farius --    help you find a place to hide?
There's no hiding from the    Syndicate. You know that.
Then turn yourself in. You'll be    safe in prison.
No. They'd go after my family.    Make an example of me.
But Raimus would leave them alone    if he thinks I died not knowing    about you.
You can't just let the Klingons    kill you...
What choice do I have!
How did I let this happen? I    should've known... you were too    good to be true. But I wanted so    much to believe my luck had    changed, I didn't see it. I    didn't see.
Bilby, I never meant for this to    happen. I wasn't after you, I was    only trying to find out how the    Syndicate had compromised    Starfleet.
I wasn't even your target.       I suppose I'm not important   enough.
I've always known something like    this might happen.        The smart thing would be to kill    you... but I guess I've already    proved I'm not too smart...
Bilby... I'm sorry.
You'll never know how little    comfort that is...
If it's not too much trouble, can    you make sure Chester's looked    after?
Be good.
Can I ask you something?        Back home -- wherever that is --    do you have a family?
Good. That's the most important    thing.
I'll never forget the look on    his face when he found out who I    really was...
You took an enormous risk telling    him. He could've killed you.
I knew he wouldn't.
Well, all I can say is you're    lucky Chadwick decided not to put    everything that happened in his    report.
Julian, don't you understand what    I'm trying to tell you? Bilby    trusted me. He put his life in my    hands. And I killed him. Just as    sure as if I'd pulled the trigger    myself.
That's not fair and you know it.    You did what you had to do -- your    duty.
Is that what I'm supposed to tell    myself?
It's the truth.
Look, I'm sorry I don't have all    the answers. All I know for sure    is that I'm glad you're back.
